question_sentence: Which country has become the third in Asia to legalise same-sex marriage?
evidence: Having long been home to a lively LGBTQ+ scene, Thailand joins Nepal and Taiwan in becoming the third Asian nation to legalise same-sex marriage. Hundreds of couples around the country tied the knot on Thursday, when the equal marriage law – approved last summer – finally came into effect.

question_sentence: Which highly anticipated romance-fantasy novel by Rebecca Yarros finally hit the shelves?
evidence: Rebecca Yarros' "Onyx Storm," the latest instalment in her Empyrean series, has been one of the most eagerly awaited romance-fantasy releases for years. It has also been the biggest pre-ordered title since "Harry Potter and the Cursed Child" in 2016.

question_sentence: Prince Harry reached an out-of-court settlement with the publishers of which UK newspaper?
evidence: News Group Newspapers, which publishes The Sun, issued a full apology for the newspaper's "serious intrusion" into Prince Harry's private life as part of the settlement, which also includes an undisclosed but "substantial" payout for damages and legal fees. The case, which involved alleged illegal information gathering by journalists, had been set to begin on Tuesday.

question_sentence: Pete Hegseth said he would stop doing what if he's confirmed as US defence secretary?
evidence: President Donald Trump's nominee for defence secretary, Pete Hegseth, was accused by his former sister-in-law in a sworn affidavit submitted to senators of being abusive towards his second wife and of regularly drinking to the point of passing out.

question_sentence: Spain's government announced plans to ban non-EU citizens from doing what?
evidence: Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez, who has already proposed a 100% tax on property sales to non-EU citizens, has since suggested that such sales could be banned altogether. The proposal, which aims to tackle property speculation and drive down housing costs, would not apply to foreigners who reside in Spain.

question_sentence: Conflict has broken out between guerrilla groups in which country?
evidence: The conflict in ColoArticlesmbia's Catatumbo region is the country's worst civil violence since its largest guerrilla army, the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (better known as FARC), put down arms in 2016 in a peace deal with the government.

question_sentence: What country was put back on to the US government's list of state sponsors of terrorism just a week after being removed?
evidence: As part of a flurry of action on his first day back in office, President Trump ordered the State Department to re-designate Cuba a "state sponsor of terrorism". The list had shrunk to three nations last week – Iran, North Korea and Syria – after the outgoing Biden administration removed Cuba.

question_sentence: What was the name of the Maine Coon cat that made headlines after being left on a plane by mistake?
evidence: The eight-year-old cat, booked for a one-way Air New Zealand flight from Christchurch to Melbourne, Australia, was overlooked in the plane’s cargo hold and ended up making three trips in 24 hours between the two countries. A stowed wheelchair had blocked the baggage handler's view of her cage. She was eventually flown back to Melbourne and reunited with her owner.

question_sentence: Red weather warnings have been issued in the UK and Ireland for a storm that shares a name with which "Lord of the Rings" character?
evidence: The whole of Ireland and Northern Ireland and large parts of Scotland are under red weather warnings on Friday ahead of projected 100mph winds posing a danger to life. Residents of affected areas have been warned to stay indoors and schools will be closed.

question_sentence: Which film has been nominated for 10 Oscars?
evidence: The film, starring Adrien Brody, has been nominated for 10 Oscars, including Best Picture, Best Director and Best Actor. "The Brutalist" follows the journey of a Holocaust survivor migrating to the U.S. after the war to start a new life, has also won three Golden Globe awards.

question_sentence: Donald Trump was sworn in Monday as the 47th president of the United States. Which holiday coincided with his inauguration?
evidence: The third Monday of January is a federal holiday that commemorates the birthday of Martin Luther King Jr. This year, the holiday coincided with Donald Trump’s inauguration.

question_sentence: Which app is back online after temporarily shutting itself down in the US?
evidence: TikTok welcomed US users back after temporarily shutting itself down for about 14 hours.

question_sentence: Which type of severe weather swept through the South this week?
evidence: A once-in-a-generation winter storm wreaked havoc across the Gulf Coast with brutal cold and record snowfall.

question_sentence: Which country in Southeast Asia became the first to recognize same-sex marriage?
evidence: Hundreds of same-sex couples tied the knot across Thailand on Thursday as the country became the first in Southeast Asia to recognize marriage equality.

question_sentence: Where did President Donald Trump declare a national emergency this week?
evidence: In an effort to crack down on illegal immigration, President Trump declared a national emergency at the southern border and mandated that the US military step up its presence there.

question_sentence: Which streaming platform is raising prices after reporting its biggest-ever subscriber jump?
evidence: Netflix announced it will raise prices on most of its subscription tiers in the US and Canada after the streaming giant reported 19 million new subscribers in the last quarter of 2024.

question_sentence: Which of the following is the world’s largest coral reef?
evidence: Around 1,500 fish live in Australia's Great Barrier Reef, the world's largest coral reef. However, a new study has found that record ocean heat and coral bleaching have reached "catastrophic levels," disrupting most fish communities in the area.

question_sentence: What is the new fee to climb Mount Everest?
evidence: Nepal will increase the permit fees for climbing Mount Everest by more than 35% to $15,000, making the world's tallest peak more expensive for mountaineers for the first time in nearly a decade.

question_sentence: Which university won its first college football championship in 10 years?
evidence: Ohio State defeated Notre Dame 34-23 to win its first national title in a decade.

question_sentence: The nominations for the 97th Academy Awards were announced Thursday. Which film led with the most nods?
evidence: “Emilia Pérez” led with 13 nominations, followed by “The Brutalist” and “Wicked” with 10 each. The Oscars will air on March 2.
